item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Masashi Kishimoto
item.description: "She's strong! And scary...I bet she's single...I'd put money on it.." -- Masashi Kishimoto

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Masashi Kishimoto
item.description: "There is only one will and that is the Will of Fire. The will that doesn't let you give up" -- Masashi Kishimoto

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Masashi Kishimoto
item.description: "Dattebyo!!!" -- Masashi Kishimoto

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by haruki murakami
item.description: "Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional." -- haruki murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a <i>story</i>." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Why do people have to be this lonely? What's the point of it all? Millions of people in this world, all of them yearning, looking to others to satisfy them, yet isolating themselves. Why? Was the earth put here just to nourish human loneliness?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "two people can sleep in the same bed and still be alone when they close their eyes" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Letters are just pieces of paper," I said. "Burn them, and what stays in your heart will stay; keep them, and what vanishes will vanish." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once. " -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Only the Dead stay seventeen forever." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Don't you think it would be wonderful to get rid of everything and everybody and just go some place where you don't know a soul?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I have this strange feeling that I'm not myself anymore. It's hard to put into words, but I guess it's like I was fast asleep, and someone came, disassembled me, and hurriedly put me back together again. That sort of feeling." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Yuki Shimizu
item.description: "My days restricted... my fate decided. And in that, the one and only freedom allowed to me... was to love..." -- Yuki Shimizu

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Yuki Shimizu
item.description: "I have always always been praying in my heart... Always thinking...! If there was a Kami who truly belongs to me. If there was a Kami who only see me as most important...forever by my side, a Kami that only belongs to me... I won't mind killing or letting my life be bound by the Mitou Family. Only with that thought in mind I was able to endure... Only that thought was my support to live on... I thought that was my Kami... A Kami who only belongs to me. I always thought that." -- Yuki Shimizu

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Yuki Shimizu
item.description: "I have to remember it... or Genma-sama'll come to hate me...and then he'll abandon me... What can I do, to become the "Himi" that you want...? What do I have to do to bring back my memories? There's nothing. In my heart, there's nothing..." -- Yuki Shimizu

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Yuki Shimizu
item.description: "Himi... Even if I have to keep taking in the pain and the wounds, it'll be alright... No matter how much I bleed or how ruthless I become...as long as you come back, I'll be fine with it... As long as you come back, I can willingly give up my life for you... So please let Himi come back to me... Let my Himi come back..." -- Yuki Shimizu

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I think you still love me, but we can’t escape the fact that I’m not enough for you. I knew this was going to happen. So I’m not blaming you for falling in love with another woman. I’m not angry, either. I should be, but I’m not. I just feel pain. A lot of pain. I thought I could imagine how much this would hurt, but I was wrong." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "here she is, all mine, trying her best to give me all she can. How could I ever hurt her? But I didn’t understand then. That I could hurt somebody so badly she would never recover. That a person can, just by living, damage another human being beyond repair." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "For a while" is a phrase whose length can't be measured.At least by the person who's waiting." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I was always attracted not by some quantifiable, external beauty, but by something deep down, something absolute. Just as some people have a secret love for rainstorms, earthquakes, or blackouts, I liked that certain undefinable something directed my way by members of the opposite sex. For want of a better word, call it magnetism. Like it or not, it’s a kind of power that snares people and reels them in." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "No matter where i go, i still end up me. What's missing never changes. The scenery may change, but i'm still the same incomplete person. The same missing elements torture me with a hunger that i can never satisfy. I think that lack itself is as close as i'll come to defining myself." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Fuuma_lady add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "The sad truth is that certain types of things can't go backward. Once they start going forward, no matter what you do, they can't go back the way they were. If even one little thing goes awry, then that's how it will stay forever." -- Haruki Murakami
